medical_history.chief_complaint: Rasmussen encephalitis (RE) associated with comorbid autoimmune diseases.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with right facial and arm twitching at age 2 during a febrile illness, followed by several attacks over a period of 5 hours characterized by right-sided clonic movements. He was seizure-free until age 8, when he developed 4 to 7 seizures per day and progressed to generalized tonic-clonic seizures every 3 months. Over time, he experienced symptoms of refractory seizures and developed severe neurological deficits. Patient 2 presented with falls and myoclonic jerks at age 3 years 9 months, with symptoms evolving to intractable epilepsy over 22 months. Patient 3 presented with seizures from age 6 associated with infections and progressed to worsening motor and cognitive functions. Patient 4 had intractable seizures from age 14, evolving until diagnosed with RE at age 28.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 developed hypothyroidism and a mild goiter at age 14 years 7 months. Patient 2 was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis at age 10 years 10 months. Patient 3 had a history of epilepsy with psychiatric manifestations. Patient 4 was later diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus at age 33.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1's brother has type 1 diabetes diagnosed at age 14. No relevant family history for the other patients is mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 2 experienced difficulties with treatment compliance due to a low socioeconomic background. Other social histories are not specified.
